what: Collection of data and function used in the Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases with R book
title: Collection of data and function used in the Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases with R book
text: goal hmsidwR provide set data used Health Metrics Spread Infectious Diseases Machine Learning Applications Spatial Modeling Analysis R book.

title: Collection of data and function used in the Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases with R book
text: can install development version hmsidwR GitHub :

title: Collection of data and function used in the Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases with R book
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(hmsidwR) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union data(sdi90_19) head(subset(sdi90_19, location == "Global")) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   location  year value #>   <chr>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 Global    1990 0.511 #> 2 Global    1991 0.516 #> 3 Global    1992 0.521 #> 4 Global    1993 0.525 #> 5 Global    1994 0.529 #> 6 Global    1995 0.534 sdi_avg <- sdi90_19 |>   group_by(location) |>   reframe(sdi_avg = round(mean(value), 3))  head(sdi_avg) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   location       sdi_avg #>   <chr>            <dbl> #> 1 Aceh             0.58  #> 2 Acre             0.465 #> 3 Afghanistan      0.238 #> 4 Aguascalientes   0.606 #> 5 Aichi            0.846 #> 6 Akita            0.792 sdi90_19 |>   filter(location %in% c("Global", "Italy", "France", "Germany")) |>   group_by(location) |>   reframe(sdi_avg = round(mean(value), 3)) |>   head() #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   location sdi_avg #>   <chr>      <dbl> #> 1 France     0.79  #> 2 Germany    0.863 #> 3 Global     0.58  #> 4 Italy      0.763

what: hmsidwR: Collection of data and function used in the Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases with R book — hmsidwR-package
title: hmsidwR: Collection of data and function used in the Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases with R book — hmsidwR-package
text: package provides data sets author's functions used Health Metrics Spread Infectious Diseases R book CRC Press. book provides tools calculating DALYs (YLLs+YLDs), important health metrics. also shows R code modeling infectious diseases machine learning. Finally, allows user understand visualize results making maps.

title: hmsidwR: Collection of data and function used in the Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases with R book — hmsidwR-package
text: Maintainer: Federica Gazzelloni fede.gazzelloni@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: Custom ggplot2 theme function — theme_hmsid
text: Custom ggplot2 theme function

title: Custom ggplot2 theme function — theme_hmsid
code: theme_hmsid(   base_size,   text_size,   subtitle_size,   subtitle_margin,   plot_title_size,   plot_title_margin,   ... )

title: Custom ggplot2 theme function — theme_hmsid
text: base_size base font size text_size plot text size subtitle_size, subtitle_margin plot subtitle size margin plot_title_size, plot_title_margin plot title size margin ... arguments passed theme_hmsid

title: Custom ggplot2 theme function — theme_hmsid
text: customized theme ggplot object.

title: Custom ggplot2 theme function — theme_hmsid
code: if (FALSE) { library(ggplot2) dat <- data.frame(x=seq_along(1:5),                   y=rnorm(n = 5,mean = 0.5,sd = 1)) dat |> ggplot(aes(x=x,y=y))+ geom_line()+ theme_hmsid() }
